parts:
These are the requirements I need to fulfil for my coding technical assessment. Please chart a 3 month programme for me to master these skills. Assume I already have basic Python programming, have had some experience training ML models in scikit-learn, and am already good at data cleaning and outlier identification (but not necessarily good at justifying how my findings influence my ML model training).

---

Knowledge and Proficiency Requirements:
 
Intermediate programming experience in Python. 
Understand basic data pre-processing (handling missing data, outliers etc…)
Able to build machine learning models
Able to build data pipelines to train and build your models
Able to perform basic code documentation (Readme, docstrings and requirements.txt)
Able to deploy your models in Docker containers
Able to provision and use cloud computing infrastructure such as Google Cloud, Microsoft Azure or AWS
Able to do Linux shell scripting
Able to use at least one of the following databases and data processing technologies such as SQL, NoSQL, Apache Hadoop and/or Apache Spark
Able to use GitHub/GitLab and perform proper code check-in/out and repository

User is preparing for a coding technical assessment that requires skills in Docker, cloud computing (GCP/Azure/AWS), Linux shell scripting, SQL/NoSQL/Hadoop/Spark, GitHub/GitLab, ML pipelines, and model deployment.

Given your background and the technical assessment requirements, here’s a focused 3-month (12-week) plan to master the necessary skills. The program emphasizes hands-on tasks and progressive complexity, assuming you already have foundational Python and ML knowledge.

---

## 🗓️ 3-Month Technical Assessment Prep Plan

### 🧭 Structure Overview
- **Total Duration**: 12 weeks
- **Weekly Commitment**: 12–15 hours (can be scaled up or down)
- **Phases**:
  - **Phase 1 (Weeks 1–4): Core Infrastructure and Tools**
  - **Phase 2 (Weeks 5–8): Intermediate ML Pipelines & Deployment**
  - **Phase 3 (Weeks 9–12): Integration & Project Simulation**

---

### 🟦 Phase 1: Core Infrastructure and Tools (Weeks 1–4)

#### 📌 Week 1: Git, Documentation, Shell
- Learn Git branching, rebasing, merge conflicts, PRs
- Use GitHub/GitLab projects, issues, and Actions
- Write README, docstrings, `requirements.txt`
- Basics of Bash (loops, conditionals, file ops, variables)

**Resources**:
- [Pro Git Book](https://git-scm.com/book/en/v2)
- Bash scripting on [tldp.org](https://tldp.org/LDP/Bash-Beginners-Guide/html/)

---

#### 📌 Week 2: SQL and NoSQL
- SQL basics: SELECT, JOIN, GROUP BY, subqueries
- NoSQL: MongoDB basics (CRUD, schema design)

**Practice**:
- SQLZoo, LeetCode SQL problems
- MongoDB University’s free M001 course

---

#### 📌 Week 3: Docker Fundamentals
- Dockerfile creation, image layering
- docker-compose
- Bind mounts, volumes
- Publishing models as REST APIs (e.g., with FastAPI + Docker)

**Mini-Project**:
- Deploy a scikit-learn model via FastAPI in a Docker container

---

#### 📌 Week 4: Cloud Foundations
- Choose one: AWS (preferred), GCP, or Azure
- Basics: IAM, compute instances, cloud storage, CLI tools
- Deploy a Docker container to a VM (e.g., EC2 or GCP Compute)

**Resources**:
- AWS Cloud Practitioner Essentials
- GCP Essentials Qwiklabs

---

### 🟩 Phase 2: ML Pipelines and Deployment (Weeks 5–8)

#### 📌 Week 5: Data Pipelines
- Modular Python scripts: ingestion → cleaning → training → output
- Use `scikit-learn` Pipelines and ColumnTransformers
- Learn joblib/pickle serialization

**Goal**: Understand how preprocessing affects model performance

---

#### 📌 Week 6: Spark or Hadoop
- Spark (preferred): PySpark basics (RDDs, DataFrames, MLlib)
- Local Spark installation and use with Docker

**Project**:
- Train a simple ML model using PySpark

---

#### 📌 Week 7: CI/CD Basics & Automation
- GitHub Actions / GitLab CI: automate tests, linting, deployments
- Automate pipeline: code → test → Docker image → deploy to cloud

---

#### 📌 Week 8: Intermediate Model Deployment
- Use `mlflow` or `FastAPI` for serving models
- Add logging, performance monitoring (e.g., Prometheus or custom logs)
- Re-deploy your previous models with enhancements

---

### 🟨 Phase 3: Integration & Simulation (Weeks 9–12)

#### 📌 Week 9–10: Capstone Project Part I
- Build a complete ML system:
  - ETL from SQL/CSV source
  - Clean, transform, train ML model
  - Use scikit-learn pipeline
  - Serialize and deploy with FastAPI in Docker
  - Log metrics
  - Push to GitHub

#### 📌 Week 11–12: Capstone Project Part II
- Deploy to chosen cloud (AWS/GCP)
- Add version control with Git + README + CI/CD
- Write a report: how preprocessing choices affected performance

---

## 📦 Tools Stack Summary

| Skill                 | Tool/Tech                     |
|----------------------|-------------------------------|
| ML Pipelines         | `scikit-learn`, `mlflow`      |
| Model Deployment     | `FastAPI`, `Docker`           |
| Cloud                | AWS / GCP                      |
| Shell Scripting      | `bash`                         |
| Data Handling        | SQL, MongoDB, PySpark         |
| CI/CD                | GitHub Actions / GitLab CI    |
| Version Control      | Git + GitHub/GitLab           |
| Documentation        | Markdown, docstrings          |

---

Would you like a Notion board, Trello board, or markdown schedule template to help track this plan?
Summarize recommended resources that I should refer to including books, courses, youtube videos, etc

Here’s a curated list of **recommended resources**—books, courses, and videos—aligned with your 3-month preparation plan. The list prioritizes **depth, clarity, and practical relevance** to your technical assessment.

---

## 🧠 Programming & Shell Scripting

### 🟩 Git, GitHub/GitLab
- 📘 **Book**: *Pro Git* by Scott Chacon – [https://git-scm.com/book/en/v2](https://git-scm.com/book/en/v2)
- 🎓 **Course**: [Codecademy’s Git Course](https://www.codecademy.com/learn/learn-git)
- 📺 **YouTube**: [GitHub for Beginners](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=RGOj5yH7evk) – freeCodeCamp

### 🟩 Bash/Linux Shell
- 📘 [Bash Guide for Beginners – TLDP](https://tldp.org/LDP/Bash-Beginners-Guide/html/)
- 🎓 [LinuxCommand.org](http://linuxcommand.org/)
- 📺 [Bash Scripting Tutorial](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=SPwyp2NG-bI) – ProgrammingKnowledge

---

## 💾 Databases: SQL and NoSQL

### 🟦 SQL
- 🎓 [Mode SQL Tutorial](https://mode.com/sql-tutorial/)
- 🎓 [LeetCode SQL Practice](https://leetcode.com/problemset/database/)
- 📺 [SQL Full Course](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=HXV3zeQKqGY) – freeCodeCamp

### 🟦 NoSQL (MongoDB)
- 🎓 [MongoDB University – M001: MongoDB Basics](https://university.mongodb.com/courses/M001/about)
- 📘 *MongoDB: The Definitive Guide* by Kristina Chodorow (O’Reilly)
- 📺 [MongoDB Crash Course](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=-56x56UppqQ) – Traversy Media

---

## 🐍 ML Pipelines, Scikit-learn, Deployment

### 🟨 ML Pipelines & Theory
- 📘 *Introduction to Machine Learning with Python* by Andreas Müller and Sarah Guido (O’Reilly)
- 🎓 [DataCamp: Building ML Pipelines with scikit-learn](https://www.datacamp.com/courses/building-machine-learning-pipelines-in-python)
- 📺 [Scikit-learn Full Course](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=0Lt9w-BxKFQ) – freeCodeCamp

### 🟨 Model Deployment (FastAPI + Docker)
- 🎓 [Deploy ML Models with FastAPI and Docker](https://www.udemy.com/course/fastapi-the-complete-guide-2023/) (Udemy)
- 📺 [FastAPI Crash Course](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=0sOvCWFmrtA) – freeCodeCamp
- 📺 [Docker + FastAPI for ML Deployment](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=3dlW1Yt8i6A) – Data with Tinh

---

## 📦 Docker & DevOps

- 📘 *Docker Deep Dive* by Nigel Poulton
- 🎓 [Docker Mastery (Udemy)](https://www.udemy.com/course/docker-mastery/)
- 📺 [Docker Crash Course](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=fqMOX6JJhGo) – Traversy Media

---

## ☁️ Cloud Platforms

### 🟪 AWS (recommended)
- 🎓 [AWS Cloud Practitioner Essentials](https://explore.skillbuilder.aws/learn/course/external/view/elearning/134/aws-cloud-practitioner-essentials)
- 🎓 [Qwiklabs: AWS Essentials](https://www.qwiklabs.com/quests/23)
- 📺 [AWS Full Course](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ulprqHHWlng) – freeCodeCamp

### 🟪 GCP/Azure (optional alternatives)
- [Google Cloud Skill Boosts](https://www.cloudskillsboost.google/)
- [Microsoft Learn for Azure](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/training/)

---

## 🔥 Spark / Hadoop

- 📘 *Learning Spark* (2nd Ed) by Jules S. Damji et al. – O’Reilly
- 🎓 [Databricks Academy](https://academy.databricks.com/)
- 📺 [PySpark Full Course](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=9k7YxR9Y0NQ) – freeCodeCamp

---

## 🛠️ CI/CD

- 🎓 [GitHub Actions Bootcamp](https://www.udemy.com/course/github-actions/)
- 📺 [GitHub Actions Crash Course](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=eB0nUzAI7M8) – Code with Mosh

---

## 🧰 Documentation & Code Quality

- 📘 *Clean Code* by Robert C. Martin (optional, for code style)
- 🎓 [Google Python Style Guide](https://google.github.io/styleguide/pyguide.html)
- 📺 [How to Write Great README](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=HUBNt18RFbo) – Code Academy

---

Would you like this turned into a Notion database or markdown checklist to track your progress?
